author: pdobacz
content:
Sounds right, I've always thought about it as two types though:
A. Has full data and can be executed (be it from an account, EOFCREATE initcode or TXCREATE initcode)
B. Doesn't have full data and can only be used by RETURNCONTRACT, where the data is filled and data_size updated to match

(A.) is ensured by either EOF validation (for EOFCREATE), runtime validation (for TXCREATE) and by (B.) (for account code)
